Text: Auguries of Innocence (poetry collection):  This collection of poetry includes exactly twenty-six recent poems penned by the active, contemporary poet.

Text: Auguries of Innocence (poetry collection):  Obviously William Blake is a dominant influence on the poet herself, since it shares its title, Auguries of Innocence, with one of William Blake's poems.

5:
--------------------
Text: Auguries of Innocence (poetry collection):  One commonality between this collection and that by Blake's, in regard to the content, is that the poems collected here exhibit subtle nods to Blake.
Triplets:<Auguries of Innocence
6:
--------------------
Text: Auguries of Innocence (poetry collection):  For example, in one of her poems, "The Long Road", by the end of the very first verse the reader has already been exposed to such suggestive visuals as the speaker of the poem sleeping in chimneys and chewing on bulbs, as well as the speaker "sweeping time".
